bomberMan.gamePlay.Model

Class Character

  • java.lang.Object
    • bomberMan.gamePlay.Model.GameObject
      • bomberMan.gamePlay.Model.Character
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Position, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BomberMan, Enemy

    public class Character
extends GameObject
implements java.io.Serializable
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Character()
      Constructor This method takes care of the initialization of the different types of variables that each character has, including the number of Lives, If the character is alive or dead, and the speed of movements(in pixels).
      Character(int xPos, int yPos, java.lang.String location, java.lang.String objectType)
      Constructor This method takes care of the initialization of the different types of variables that each character has, including the number of Lives, If the character is alive or dead, and the speed of movements(in pixels).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Character

        public Character()
        Constructor This method takes care of the initialization of the different types of variables that each character has, including the number of Lives, If the character is alive or dead, and the speed of movements(in pixels). This Constructor is not used yet

      • Character

        public Character(int xPos,
                 int yPos,
                 java.lang.String location,
                 java.lang.String objectType)
        Constructor This method takes care of the initialization of the different types of variables that each character has, including the number of Lives, If the character is alive or dead, and the speed of movements(in pixels).
        Parameters:
        xPos - is the x position on the screen
        yPos - is the y position on the screen
        location - is the image location
        objectType - is the objectType if it is enemy or bomberman
